definition: to transfer/to move to another post
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Mike's boss slammed the door on his request for a job transfer.
sentences.chinese: 麦可要求调任时，他的老板赏了他闭门羹。

sentences.english: Tom's boss slammed the door on his request for a job transfer.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆要求调任时，他的老板让他吃了闭门羹。

sentences.english: My father has been transferred to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 我的父亲已经被调任到日本了。

sentences.english: He is transfered from store to accounting.
sentences.chinese: 他已从仓库调任至会计室。

sentences.english: My father will have been transferred to Japan for six years by the time I graduate from the university.
sentences.chinese: 我的父亲将在我大学毕业时被调任到日本六年了。

sentences.english: During that talk he made the first public announcement of my transfer to command of overlord.
sentences.chinese: 在他的讲词中，首次公开宣布我调任“统主”指挥。

sentences.english: So when the opportunity came for a transfer I took it.
sentences.chinese: 所以我抓住一个调任机会，成功换岗了。

sentences.english: He has been transferred to be head of a workshop.
He has promoted from storage to conference room.
sentences.chinese: 他已从仓库调任至会计室。

sentences.english: My father is transferred to Japan in summer every year.
sentences.chinese: 我的父亲每年夏天被调任到日本。

sentences.english: Later he moved to South Africa as technical director of BMW's plant in Rosslyn.
sentences.chinese: 不久，他调任南非罗斯林的工厂任技术主管。

sentences.english: My father had been transferred to Japan when I was nineteen years old.
sentences.chinese: 我十九岁时，我的父亲被调任到日本。

definition: to be promoted to
to hold an office or post
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
to appoint/(job) appointment/CL:紙|纸[zhi3]
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to promote (sb)/to upgrade/to ascend
post/position/job/duties
successor/(attributive) future
temporary assignment to a Chinese government or CCP post
to set apart/to assign sb to a job
to travel to take up a new post
to promote and appoint
to resign from office/to dismiss from office
to take office/to assume a post
